image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers announces the federal government's stalled superannuation tax increases will be reworked after criticism over the plan.

title.children: Government offers major concessions on proposed super tax increase

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: SA Police and ADF personnel will resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's mid-north tomorrow.

title.children: Breaking: Police resume search for missing boy Gus in SA outback

image.altText: The silhouettes of four people. Behind them is a textured background with a red and white Qantas kangaroo logo.

props.synopsis: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

title.children: What can you do if your Qantas data has hit the dark web?

image.altText: A group of people sits together surrounded by Israeli flags

props.synopsis: Israel says it expects the release of hostages will begin shortly, as a ceasefire with Hamas continues to hold in Gaza. Follow live.

title.children: Israeli hostages due to be released shortly as Trump says 'the war is over'

image.altText: Prince Andrew looks away from the camera lens, with a BBC logo at the top of the image.

props.synopsis: Prince Andrew's relationship with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is back in the spotlight after UK media published an email between the pair over the weekend.

title.children: Prince Andrew told Epstein 'we'll play some more soon' in email, UK media reports

image.altText: A large formation of bleached staghorn coral underwater in Ningaloo.

props.synopsis: An international report from climate scientists suggests tipping points for coral reefs have been reached, putting them at risk of dieback.

title.children: Planet's first climate tipping point already reached: international study

image.altText: A sign at the front of Caboolture Hospital.

props.synopsis: Thousands more patients have been caught up in a bungle involving medical scans not being reviewed by doctors at a major south-east Queensland hospital.

title.children: Major review of medical scans at Caboolture Hospital to include 3,000 more patients

image.altText: Carter Gordon playing for the Wallabies in 2023.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies waste no time in welcoming back fly half Carter Gordon to rugby union, less than two hours after it was announced he was leaving the NRL.

title.children: Gordon rushed back into Wallabies squad only hours after quitting NRL

image.altText: A black and white image of Donald Trump, overlaid with small yellow circles, his signature, and a helicopter.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's wealth has skyrocketed since his return to the White House nine months ago, leading to accusations that he is profiting from the presidency.

title.children: 'Outrageous conflict of interest': Crypto is making the Trumps hundreds of millions of dollars

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing navy blue police uniform looks on sideways

props.synopsis: Victoria Police will slim down its executive team and divert more officers to the front line under reforms aimed at reducing crime in the state.

title.children: Breaking: Victoria Police to slim down executive, divert more officers to front line

image.altText: Person in protective suit inside chamber with pipes and blue light.

props.synopsis: The two great technology revolutions of the modern era — artificial intelligence and renewable energy — are colliding.

title.children: Once the butt of jokes, now a great hope: The race for fusion energy

image.altText: Board showing ASX stocks in the red.

props.synopsis: Local investors react calmly to Wall Street's hair-on-fire session on Friday. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX slips on renewed trade war fears

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China flexes its muscle on rare earths as exports plummet
China's exports accelerate despite US tariff threats
ASIC updates claim against Equity Trustees, seeks compensation

image.altText: Essendon captain Zach Merrett stands in the race looking up as he waits to leads his team out at Carrara.

props.synopsis: Zach Merrett is one of a number of former All-Australians currently in limbo as West Coast continues to wheel and deal after another wooden spoon. Follow live as the AFL trade period kicks into its second week.

title.children: Hawks defender emerges as potential piece to break Merrett deadlock

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Done deal! Will Brodie has been traded to Port Adelaide
Done deal! Tylar Young has been traded to West Coast
Done deal! GWS and Western Bulldogs complete pick swap

image.altText: Woman in green blazer and shoulder-length brown hair looking off to the distance, a neutral expression on her face

props.synopsis: Jelena Dokic was abused by her father for years, with no tennis success enough to stop the beatings. She reveals the complex grief of losing a parent who showed no remorse.

title.children: Jelena Dokic tried to reconcile with her dad. His response shocked her

image.altText: Kane Minion wearing a beanie with a dog sleeping on his chest

props.synopsis: Kane Minion was killed by dogs on a south-east Queensland property in 2022.

title.children: Coronial inquest begins into death of meter reader mauled by dogs

image.altText: Mr Hasic in a black trench coat, pink shirt, smiling in front of a pier.

props.synopsis: Safuan Hasic, also known as Steven Hasic, has been barred from practising after breaching infection control standards at his Mortdale dentistry practice.

title.children: Sydney dentist denies claims patients potentially exposed to HIV

image.altText: Close up of smiling young woman holding smartphone and tapping screen.

props.synopsis: You might assume home loan repayments will automatically reduce when an interest rate cut is passed on, but this isn’t always the case. Here's how to check.

title.children: How to make sure your minimum repayments are reduced after an RBA rate cut

image.altText: Diane Keaton, wearing tinted glasses and black and white chequed top and scarf, smiles in a head-and-shouloder shot

props.synopsis: The actor's cause of death has not been made public, but with US media reporting her family chose to keep her health decline private.

title.children: Diane Keaton's family kept 'sudden' health decline private

image.altText: a man with scruffy grey beard

props.synopsis: Independent MP Craig Garland applied in court for a restricted license, saying it would be a "terrible situation" if he wasn't able to attend parliamentary sitting weeks in Hobart due to the ban.

title.children: MP handed six-month driving suspension over cannabis charge

image.altText: A sign on a brick wall reads 'Western Sydney University', in the distance are some large buildings.

props.synopsis: As Western Sydney University prepares to shed hundreds of staff due to its dire finances, leaked documents reveal it is paying consultants as much as $2,850 a day.

title.children: University staff outraged as high-paid consultants work on redundancies

image.altText: The GrainCorp factory in Numurkah emitting smoke.

props.synopsis: The class action was brought by a northern Victorian man who alleged that noise and odour pollution from a GrainCorp factory affected his health.

title.children: GrainCorp settles class action over noise and pollution

image.altText: Police tape around a backyard.

props.synopsis: Peter Damjanovic changes his plea at the last minute and pleads guilty to murdering his former partner Tiffany Woodley at her home in Bedford two years ago. WARNING: Indigenous readers are advised this story contains photos of someone who has died.

title.children: 'I’m a murderer': Man admits killing mother-of-three inside Perth home

image.altText: A giant flame roars from gas flare stack, silhouetted against the dusk sky

props.synopsis: Advocacy group Climate Integrity has accused the gas industry of using "distorted research", produced by the accounting firm EY, to influence the Australian government's Future Gas Strategy.

title.children: ACCC urged to probe 'distorted research' behind government gas policy

image.altText: A man with short grey hair in a white collared shirt and grey jeans stands with his hands in his pockets beside a picket fence.

props.synopsis: Police have charged two boys, aged 14 and 15, over two alleged early morning break-ins in Melbourne — one of which allegedly saw a man chase and restrain a teenager.

title.children: Teens charged after home owner detains alleged 15-year-old intruder

image.altText: Eugowra flooding more_Mat Reid

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest is told residents and emergency responders got inaccurate information from the Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) and Water NSW during a devastating flood that claimed two lives in the NSW town of Eugowra.

title.children: Official information about deadly flood was inaccurate, inquest told

image.altText: Judy and Bob Dent in an older photo. He is wearing a navy suit and she is wearing a long white dress.

props.synopsis: On the verandah of their Darwin home, Judy Dent held her husband's hand as he became the first person in the world to die through legally accessible voluntary assisted dying. That world-first would not be possible in the Northern Territory today.

title.children: Judy's husband was the first person in the world to die under VAD laws

image.altText: A woman holding a bear.

props.synopsis: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government improve care for women who experience miscarriage in rural communities.

title.children: Rural women 60 per cent more likely to lose pregnancies, report finds

image.altText: A large group of people wave flags and hold placards while demonstrating in front of a government building.

props.synopsis: Troops from an elite unit of the country's military are urging fellow soldiers to disobey orders and back student protesters.

title.children: Student-led coup attempt underway in Madagascar, president says

image.altText: a kaola called gage looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Koala deaths on Appin Road are not unusual this time of year, but the fatality of rescued koala Gage is cause for more than the usual frustration and despair.

title.children: Beloved koala killed after being hailed a conservation success story

image.altText: The jetty at Ardrossan.

props.synopsis: Some travellers to South Australia's coast over summer will be able to access $500 accommodation vouchers and $50 cashback on their meal, under a state and federal government plan to stimulate tourism.

title.children: $50 meal refunds, $500 travel vouchers in SA's algal bloom summer plan

image.altText: A dark-haired man in a baggy green cap and cricket whites – Australian captain Pat Cummins – holds up a cricket ball.

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins all but rules himself out of the first Ashes Test, saying he is still a way short of completing his condensed recovery schedule from a back injury.

title.children: Cummins 'probably unlikely' to play in first Ashes Test

image.altText: Brightly coloured green and purple lights shine over a mountain.

props.synopsis: A light installation, projected onto King George Sound in Albany, will be the largest ever created.

title.children: Light show visible from space set to illuminate WA's south coast
